CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 16, 1958, pg. B2, reads: "Spinning Yarns - Whenever a dozen or more oldtimers get together, the irresistible pastime is yarn-spinning. G. Washington, seated left, seems to have the chair.  Front row listeners, seated left to right, are Mrs. Helen Thompson, Mrs. Rhoda Barnard, Albert Hinton, Mrs. Hattie Franklin, Mrs. Rosa Scarver, Robert Spencer, John Rodgers, Mrs. Ina Boykins and C. Hawkins.  Standing, clockwise: Mmes Mary S. Davis, I. A. Murray, Martha Smith, Fannie E. Morton and Jessie Miles."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of elderly women and men, including front row: G. Washington, Helen Thompson, Rhoda Barnard, Albert Hinton, Hattie Franklin, Rosa Scarver, Robert Spencer, John Rodgers, Ina Boykins, and C. Hawkins; standing: Mary S. Davis, I. A. Murray, Martha Smith, Fannie E. Morton, and Jessie Miles, gathered for 30th annual outing of James East Liberty Missionary Society of Ebenezer Baptist Church
